required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of 90% Effective Dose of Metaraminol in Supine and Left Tilt Positions on Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 90% Effective Dose of Metaraminol in Supine and Left Tilt Positions on Cesarean Section：A Non-inferiority Trial

brief_summary.textblock: For hypotension after spinal anesthesia, metaraminol has different 90% effective doses in the supine position and the left-tilt position. We plan to conduct a non-inferiority trial to compare the effects of the two on the fetus and the mother.

primary_outcome.description: pH value of fetal umbilical artery blood

secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with systolic blood pressure reduction >20% baseline value or systolic blood pressure <90 mm Hg before delivery

Number of Participants with heart rate was ≤50 bpm before delivery Number of Participants with heart rate was ≤50 bpm before delivery Number of Participants with heart rate was ≤50 bpm before delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of nausea in pregnant women

secondary_outcome.description: base excess of fetal umbilical artery blood

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of vomiting in pregnant women

arm_group.description: After spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed in a 15° left position until the fetus was delivered, and metaraminol was given at an initial rate of 2.00μg/kg/min throughout the process.
After spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed in a supine position until the fetus was delivered, and metaraminol was given at an initial rate of 2.7μg/kg/min throughout the process.

intervention.description: After spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed in a supine position until the fetus was delivered, and metaraminol was given at an initial rate of 2.7μg/kg/min throughout the process.
After spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed in left-tilt position until the fetus was delivered, and metaraminol was given at an initial rate of 2μg/kg/min throughout the process.
